alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 30 at 12:22PM HST until November 30 at 1:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... At 1222 PM HST, radar and rain gauges indicated that rainfall rates have diminished over the past couple of hours. However, runoff levels remain high. Highway 132 near Four Corners has been closed. Pohaku Drive in Orchidland Estates remains closed. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Honokaa, Volcano, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Glenwood, Mountain View, Wood Valley, Pahala, Hawaiian Acres, Keaau, Orchidlands Estates, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Pahoa, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Honomu and Naalehu. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. The heavy rains may cause rock and mudslides in steep terrain areas.
